habitat_description:
The range of this species is from south central Arizona along the Pacific Coast of Mexico (Behler and King 1979). In Arizona, this desert adapted species is found near pools surrounded by mesquite in the Lower Colorado River Desertscrub and Semidesert Grassland (Brennan and Holycross 2009).
Behler and King (1979) described Pternohyla fodiens to inhabit arid grassy areas and open mesquite woodlands occurring at an elevational range from sea level to approximately 1500 meters. Breeding occurs in temporary pools usually filled by rains such as earthen cattle tanks, depressions, and washes, but also along roads. Little is documented about juvenile and adult habitat (Lannoo 2005).

Found in pools near mesquite trees and even observed to climb the lower portions of them (Brennan and Holycross 2009).
